meanings.definition: A person or group of people accompanying another for protection, guidance, or courtesy.
meanings.sent1: The kind escort walked the elderly lady safely across the busy street.
meanings.sent2: The security guard acted as an escort for the VIP guest at the event.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her teddy bear was her escort on the adventure.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky served as a twinkling escort for the moon.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog was the perfect escort for the blind man, guiding him with care.

meanings.definition: To accompany someone as a gesture of courtesy or for protection.
meanings.sent1: She offered to escort her friend home after the movie to ensure she got there safely.
meanings.sent2: The bodyguard will escort the celebrity through the crowd to shield them from fans.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to escort the mouse out of the house, showing unexpected kindness.
meanings.sent4: The wind will escort the fallen leaves across the yard in a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to escort the princess through the dangerous forest, protecting her from harm.

meanings.definition: A person hired to accompany someone socially.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy businessman always had a stylish escort by his side at events.
meanings.sent2: The actress arrived at the premiere with her escort, turning heads with their elegance.
meanings.sent3: The penguin strutted around the zoo with a fish escort, feeling quite important.
meanings.sent4: The sun made a grand entrance with its radiant escort of colorful clouds.
meanings.sent5: The queen made a regal appearance with her royal escort, impressing all who saw her.
